title: Provincial Court Family Law Act Protection Order

elements.name: urgencyPOInfo
elements.title:
Normally, you need to give notice to the Other Party that you are applying for a `Protection Order`. You give notice to the Other Party by having the application documents served personally to them.

The period of time between the day that the Other Party is served and the day that the application is heard is called the "notice period" or "notice".
Normally, you must serve the other party with at least 7 days' notice of the court appearance.
A judge can decide to change the amount of notice you give the Other Party if the Other Party can be served but your situation requires a court order sooner than 7 days.

A judge can also decide to review your application without Other Party being given notice until after the Protection Order is made if notice on the Other Party is unreasonable because of special circumstances like you or your children are in imminent danger of harm, or providing notice in advance would probably have serious consequences.

elements.name: PORSpeedUp
elements.title: Normally, the other party will need to be given notice that you are applying for a Protection Order at least 7 days before the date scheduled for court. Do you need this Protection Order application to be heard sooner (you will be asking the court to be allowed to give less than 7 days' notice to the other party )?

elements.name: PORDaysToNotice
elements.title: How many days' notice do you want to give the other party?

elements.name: whyAllowNotice
elements.title: Explain why you want a judge to allow you to give the other party {PORDaysToNotice} days' notice of your application?
elements.description:
Provide the facts you want the court to consider, including:
  • why the other party should be given less than 7 days' notice?
  • why the application or your situation is urgent or what special circumstances exist?
  • what do you believe will happen if you have to wait 7 days to have the application heard?

elements.name: PORNoNotice
elements.title:
Normally, a judge will want to hear from you, {ApplicantName} and the other party before making a decision.

Do you want a judge to make their decision before the other party gets to tell their story?

elements.name: PORWhyNoNotice
elements.title: Explain why you want a judge to make their decision before the other party gets to tell their story.
elements.description:
Provide the facts you want the court to consider, including:
  • why the other party should not be given notice?
  • why the application or your situation is urgent or what special circumstances exist?
  • what do you believe will happen if the other party is served or given notice of your application and a chance to attend court at the same time as you?
